abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, who has not been formally charged in George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal, will figure prominently in trial in which some of his former aides face charges of conspiracy to commit fraud and conspiracy against civil rights; critics say Christie's wielding of bridge access as political leverage reveals picture of machinations behind his onetime presidential ambitions.

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Governor Christie has not been charged in the case involving a traffic tie-up at the George Washington Bridge, but he will loom large in the story laid out by both sides in the courtroom.
snippet: Governor Christie has not been charged in the case involving a traffic tie-up at the George Washington Bridge, but he will loom large in the story laid out by both sides in the courtroom....

headline.main: All Eyes Are on Chris Christie as Trial in Bridge Scandal Starts
headline.print_headline: Not Charged, Christie Will Still Loom Over Trial in Bridge Scandal
